importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The series begins in the 1930s, marking the start of the Kennedy family's rise, which is central to the narrative and historical context of the show.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, covering the formative years of the Kennedy family, including the rise of Joe Kennedy Sr. and the early lives of his children, particularly Jack, who later becomes president.

keyTakeAways: The new Netflix series 'Kennedy' is based on Fredrik Logevall's biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
Michael Fassbender stars as Joe Kennedy, Sr., portraying the patriarch of the Kennedy family.
The series explores both the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family, including the legacy of JFK Jr.'s death in a 1999 plane crash.
The show begins in the 1930s and follows the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother, Robert.
It is described as a blend of American mythology and a nuanced exploration of family dynamics, societal pressures, and political ambition.
The showrunner, Sam Shaw, emphasizes that the Kennedy story reflects broader themes about American history, identity, and the present moment.
The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy's upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr.
The series will run for eight episodes and does not yet have a release date.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A prominent American political dynasty, including John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy, and JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is central to the narrative, with the series exploring their rise, struggles, and tragedies, making them a cornerstone of American political mythology.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A renowned British actor known for his roles in films such as 'The Lobster' and 'The Theory of Everything'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, bringing international acclaim and star power to the series.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A historian and author, known for writing the biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is directly based on his book, providing historical authenticity and depth to the narrative.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The showrunner of the series, responsible for the creative direction and narrative structure.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provides the philosophical and thematic framing of the series, emphasizing the Kennedy story’s relevance to American identity and history.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A global streaming platform that produces and distributes original content.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is the producer and distributor of the new 'Kennedy' series, signaling its cultural significance and reach.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A television producer known for creating dramatic series like 'American Horror Story'.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is mentioned as the creator of a separate series, 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr., highlighting a distinction between this new series and others in the Kennedy legacy space.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The 35th U.S. President, born into the Kennedy family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a central figure in the family’s legacy, representing the political triumphs that have shaped American history.

namedEntities.name: Robert F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A brother of JFK, who served as a U.S. Senator and was assassinated.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His assassination and the family’s tragic history underscore the show’s exploration of family tragedy and political danger.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999 with his wife and sister-in-law.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death and the associated 'Kennedy curse' narrative are referenced as part of the family’s tragic legacy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956,' which will star Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, tracing the rise of the Kennedy family and the struggles of their children, particularly Jack, who battles to escape the shadow of his older brother Robert. The show is described as a blend of American mythology and historical realism, offering insight into both the family’s triumphs and tragedies, including political ambition, personal conflict, and fatal events such as assassinations and a 1999 plane crash. It is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story,' which focuses on JFK Jr. The series will run for eight episodes and is set for release in the future, with no official date yet announced.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
